content: So the app works as a way to play Castles of the Mad King on your phone. However there are serious QoL issues with the app. It supports multi-player, but only hot seat. Menacing you have to hand a single device around and be together in person. This is unfortunate on its own, but it also displays your favor cards to the other players when you hand them off. Tutorials are also unskippable which is annoying if you already know how to play
Great implemention but no online play.
This is a great game. The set up works well on the phone.
It is so good to play one of my favorite games! The solo campaign mode is HARD! I never thought of Castle of Mad Ludwig as a brain burner! I like this app very much! I look forward to online gaming.
No online multiplayer, so i refunded it. The main menu was very nice though!
My wife and I love this game and are just as addicted to the app version. Great job!
Meh, bought this to play with friends only to be disappointed that there is no online play. For the price point it should include online play

Love the board game. And the app version is fantastic. Adds a campaign mode. Amazing how all the iconography is kept. Superb display. And obvious thought went into putting the exact board game on your phone.
Great adaptation of the board game. Tough to find a good strategic game in app form.
Interface is a little clunky. Unrespsonsive for one phone orientation with game launcher on samsung. But good dev communication though so trust they will keep improving.
replyContent: Thanks for your response. We appreciate it. Can you tell us the device you are using at bugs@beziergames.com? We will try to evaluate the issue and get back to you.

content: Great!
Solid implementation of the BG. RECOMMEND.

On training can't get out of second page. Restarted went to play kicks me out of game. Uninstalled/reinstalled-does same thing. My wife has asked for refund. Same problem as Sara Wurtele. In case you are looking for somebody having same issues.
replyContent: Hi, sorry to hear you’ve been experiencing some crash issues. Please contact us at bugs@beziergames.com and share as much information as you can. We will definitely investigate your case. Thank you for posting!

content: Campaign feels like it was thrown together at the last minute. Needs a help page that explains the different room powers.
Love it! Gameplay is great, and I adore that I can this on the go! My fav mobile game.
Love the game but it doesn't fit my screen correctly so parts of the game I can't use like the scroll.
replyContent: We're very sorry you've encountered this issue! Please contact us at bugs@beziergames.com with your details. Include  the device you use and a screenshot. We'll do our best to resolve it. Thank you!

content: The game rarely allows me to figure out how it handles scoring, so I almost always lose to the AI. Finally uninstalled the game, to free up space for more enjoyable apps.
Good, but could really use an "undo" button
Good game. A bit slow maybe. Wish it had more "graphic appeal" but at least it's true to its physical version.

I love this game, but due to a recent update, the "game booster" app (which came with my Samsung and cannot be deleted) menu bar seems to be permanently locked on the right side of my phone screen whenever I play, which is affecting my ability to navigate some of the game functionality (ex. opening and closing the scroll). Does anyone know how to fix this? I have loads of phone games and only Casles appears to be affected. :(
replyContent: We have not had this issue reported to us before, and we'd certainly like to work this through for you. Could you share the details at bugs@beziergames.com? And any relevant screenshots would be immensely valuable. Thank you.

content: Bought this because we love the physical game and I thought we could play remotely but you have to be in the same location
Randomly generated rewards takes the fun out of the strategy. Every match is a coin flip.
replyContent: We designed the app to reflect the setup rules from the physical game which includes randomly selecting starting goals. The strategy comes in knowing what you are working toward with each room you build.

content: Would love an pvp option, not just ai
Gameplay buttons are beneath the home/back buttons on my Galaxy s10e
replyContent: We are aware of the problem and working on a solution for it. We hope to have a solution for it soon. In the meantime, rotating your device the other way should alleviate the problem for the time being.

content: Seems like a fun game. Finished the tutorial and almost got both crowns first try on the second campaign map, but I can't lay a single tile in a standard multiplayer game.
replyContent: Hello, could you please send more details to us at bugs@beziergames.com so that we can help resolve this issue?

content: Great app, but no online play
Great game! Great developer support, j was able to email and get quick replys. 👍 campaigns are nice and challenging. I sure do hope they continue to update this game.

I really liked this game. It was a bit hard at times, ALMOST seemingly impossible. It took me about a week to figure out the scoring system. Also it was way to short. Glad I got it on sale for .99 cents. Would have been kinda mad if I had paid full price. Good game though. No problems.

The game needs videos to show the player what to do in game. It also needs a in game rule book because I finished the tutorial and I am still unclear on the rules of this game. Why would I need stairs and why would I want to set game pieces? Some of the game mechanic are very complex.
An excellent recreation of the source material, could only be improved of the AI were a bit more difficult to beat!
A great alternative to the physical board game. The challenges are hard and satisfying.
Good puzzle game. Big learning curve. Worth the investment of time.
Great game ;)
The AI is pretty rough, but overall this is a good adaptation
Just like the board game
Excellent version of the board game
Excellent adaptation of the real thing. I just with there was online, play-by-mail style option.
Great game! I haven't played all that much. But from what I have played, I absolutely love this game!

The campaign is surprisingly challenging. The AI less so, but clever enough to make you pay attention. It is true to the original game and I am glad that I got it. Is it too late to ask for an update that includes the expansion, with it's swans and moats and secret doors? 😉
Wonderful game that balances luck and strategy well. True to the tabletop version!
App keeps crashing on Samsung Galaxy 8+
Great game!

if the game had a way to send bug reports, it would improve the application immensely, like to 5 stars. I learned the hard way that if you hit restart level in the pause menu, it doesn't refresh the utilities deck, and I have encountered other bugs including one involving an empty index. It's a fun game, just... the bugs make it frustrating.
amazing game, almost exactly like the board game. i just wish there was an option for a sandbox mode to just build by yourself and not have to worry about other players
Scenarios to solve vs. AI; worth buying even if you already own the board game.
This is a very fun implementation of the game!

This is a really smooth playing and enjoyable app. The rules and mechanisms are quite complex giving a very wide variety to the game. The solo campaign is really good fun and teaches you a lot of the subtleties as you try to win each new challenge. Great fun!
really love this game, i also own the actual boardgame too...
I love this game. so addictive. I just finished the campaign and I need MORE! please tell me there is another campaign in the works!?
Possibly the best board game adaptation on mobile

A fantastic adaption of a very fun game. The tutorial is robust and the career mode is challenging and unique. A great choice for anyone who likes puzzle style board games without a ton of confrontation.
Campaign mode is fun. Would be nice to have online play and AI opponents with different skill levels.
great game
A quick to learn, hard to master fun time
One of my favorite board games. The app does a beautiful job converting it to a mobile game.
slow and stupid game
A great digital version of the award-winning board game!

No way to make this a 2 player game. Instructions are limited and not user friendly. Tells you that you can play with two players but i'll be darned if there's any instructions on how to accomplish it. Keeps setting me up with AI with no option to change it to human. Very frustrated.
the digi game has the same feel as the boardgame with good (smart) bots to play with.
Love it
fun game to play solo or pass and play. only drawback is the navigation, which is a bit clunky.
super fun! this app is one of of my favorites
Great game, great app. Challenging campaign levels will keep you playing long after purchase. Quicker matches have also proven to be fun, and the perfect time-killer for me on the bus!
Great game. Absolutely worth the price.
This is a top-notch, faithful recreation of the board game. The campaign is really great and the AI is pretty good too.
this game works and is very enjoyable. hands down my favorite game right now
good app,true to the board game , would like a true online version or adjustable CPU ability/intelligence

This game seems okay at first but it is buggy af. Don't ever go to zero coins or the computer will only ever get gold on its turn when you should get it (even if it already has 60+). The computer players always seem to know what cards are in your hand and will alter how much they charge accordingly. there are levels of the campaign downright unbearable unless you happen to get ridiculously lucky every single turn. I only gave two stars because if fixed it would be really fun. As is, sucky.
I love the table top version of this game as it is one of my favorites in my collection. This app is very close. The only suggestion I could offer is an online mode to play vs other people

Enjoying game but think there might be an issue with the Schoenberg level. If you complete the objectives within 14 rounds, it doesn't end and forces you to carry on and fail. Suggestions : an undo button, an anticlockwise rotate button, options to speed up computer players (they are a bit slow), more campaigns Ps your email address at the bottom of this page is dead.
Would love to be able to play online against friends. I also agree there should be an undo button. Other than those two things, I'm really enjoying the game.

I think there a but in the campaign For the Marksburg Castle. You have to finish with 15G, you start with 30 but the first thing you have to do is buy a set of stairs for 25. After that, you can gain a maximum of 10G from completion bonuses, so you have 15G to get 100 points and you have to finish with 15G. Am I missing something, or is this a bug? BTW, it would be great if I could report bugs from the game instead of having to create a public review. I can see a bug report option, or a means of contacting you. :(
I finished the campaign and I hope they bc come out with more soon

Needs a skip the Animations button and maybe a limited undo button for when 
you fat finger the Place button instead of the Rotate button. Also several 
of the Gplay achievements are bugged. Good single player time waster. Fun 
in multiplayer too, locally. Big screens a plus.

Played the physical version of this once and found it confusing but fun. 
Excellent tutorial, lots of challenging levels with different goals to keep 
it interesting. Lots of fun!
AI is good but does not always play optimally
Excellent adaptation of the board game

Seems to work well but misses some scoring for completed basement tiles. 
Think I've lost because the completed lower level room didn't trigger
I've never bought a more boring game in my life.

Love the game. Might be good to have the rotate button slightly farther 
from the tick, as I sometimes hit accept instead of rotate, but that's more 
me needing to pay better attention. Multiplayer with friends would be a 
nice addition.

Great game love being able to play Castles against computers and without 
having to break out my board for solo. Computers and challenges make the 
levels exciting.

Great game. Needs to include the rules somewhere within the app as I didn't 
understand how downstairs rooms were scored until looking online for the 
rulebook.

Excellent game. Really good and makes you think. Only issue is , it needs 
to be optimised for smaller screens.
Really makes you think, and is a great way to get better at the game.

It's very similar to the board game other than there are a few less bonus 
cards and kings favor discs. The computer players could have different 
skill levels. The campaign does add some enjoyable puzzles, could be 
longer. I'm enjoying playing it.
Great game. The AI is not a challenging opponent though

Build a crazy castle and build up those points! A fun tile laying game with strategic elements. I do not own the physical game but I imagine it would be a pain to clean up and prepare. This removes all of that trouble! The AI is also fun to play against and provides a nice challenge as you try to build the best castle possible. Very fun way to spend your time.

It's a strange castle building game. You get points for lots of things, and that can be paralyzing (what will give you the MOST points?). But it's also just fun to just throw some rooms down. It's more complex than carcassonne, but chance are high that it you love that, you'll like this as well
A very nice port of the board game and enjoyable campaign mode.

Very true gameplay to the real game with the massive bonus of having the computer deal with the scoring, setup, & breakdown.  It's great for a quick game with friends (in person) or for honing your skills against 1, 2, or 3 bots as well as a well thought out campaign of sorts. It would be great to be able to play with friends/others online, but it would also be great if I had a flying car... so no complaints.
Great app but could use an undo button! It's easy to accidentally fix a piece and it will ruin your whole game if it's in the wrong place.

Let me start by stating that I own the actual board game and enjoy playing it. However, this app manages to take the fun out of the game, and here is how:  1) The AI does not follow the rules.  2) As others have stated there needs to be an “undo” button.  3) Support for the app is non-existent. I sent a question the developer via their website and received no reply. An online help and/or FAQ would be a great addition to this app. 4) The campaign scenarios are practically unbeatable.   5) The campaign scenarios modify the base rules, but do a very poor job explaining.   6) Navigation in the app is poor.
Fun and challanging.

My wife and I love the board game and this app version faithfully recreates the tabletop experience.  As we always play against each other (pass-and-play), I can't comment too much on the single-player mode. From the limited amount I've played, it seems to work well however.  It would be great if the Secrets expansion was made available as it adds a lot to the game.  A suggestion: in a multiplayer game, the music is the same 4 or 5 songs in a loop.  While they are all of high quality, I noticed that the single-player mode had different music.  Would it be possible to make all of the app's music available in the multiplayer mode?  Overall, this app is definitely worth the price has provided us hours upon hours of enjoyment over 60+ games.
A good game. It needs a random first player option and a way to speed up the animations for the other players and I'd give it five stars. Very well done as it currently stands though.
Campaign!
The AI is bad enough that I won my first actual game too easily, but they make up for this by having a fun campaign.

Kept losing when I played with family and friends ... not no more lol!  Campaign actually makes you think.  Play the campaign first, then play just for fun, you'll be amazed in how much you learn.  Love it!
The campaign is a lot of fun, though I wish it was a bit longer. It's still a good app version of the game and much easier to set up.
The tutorial does a good job of walking you through the steps. Definitely pay attention to connection and completion bonuses.
I love playing campaign games so I can work towards goals. Great way to improve my game!
Is there any plan to service online play?
This is a great implementation of a great board game, but the AI is simply too hard to beat, both in vs and campaign mode. There's no way to change this, either.
This is such a fun and beautiful game. The app captures the board game very well
I don't feel the game translates very well to a mobile platform.
It could have an undo button for the compulsive misclicker like me, but appart from that, really good port of the game
Great app reproducing great board game, thanks!

Really good game, it's like nothing I've seen before. I've experienced no glitches thus far. If I were going to suggest anything it would be an undo button, or perhaps a sandbox mode. But it's five stars as is and worth the price. Plus no BS in-app purchase scam junk!
Great digital version. Campaign mode has some unique and challenging objectives!
Soft and silky smooth baby
This app seems really well polished and optimized. I was a bit worried about performance after trying Suburbia... But this app is much better.
Love the board game. Nice to have it at all times.

The campaign is fabulous! The computer matches are a bit disappointing because the computers make illogical and often self sabotaging choices. It's difficult to feel like a win is legitimate sometimes.

Superb delivery of a game with much interesting decision-making. The complex scoring is offputting at first, but makes it appropriately difficult to decide on the best move. The AI is good at calculation, of course, but poor at strategic placement of tiles, making it easy to beat once you get the hang of it.  The tutorial is hard work without being very helpful; I got more from reading the original rules.

This is an incredible mobile version of an amazing board game. The campaign mode is addictive and challenging, with some fun variants that really force you to get creative and resourceful. I've only seen one bug so far, where it tells you there are no more bonus cards at a time there should be, and sure enough the AI gets to take them in later moves. This is well worth the purchase price.
A fantastic adaptation of the board game. I really love the campaign mode.
Great but DEFINITELY needs an undo feature.

Addicting game, well worth the money--both the app and board game--but there needs to be a multiplayer update to truly make things the best they could be, and to entice my friends who don't have it yet into getting the game already. Just saying, it'd make this app perfect, it's feasible to implement while not setting up everything all over as well.
Bug where you can claim the free passage reward more than once per turn if something else comes in between them (like a free action), otherwise good game.
Thanks for the game. AI needs improvement. Online multiplayer mode will be great too.
Fine game, poor implementation. Inconsistent rules, abysmal AI. I guess it might work as a pass and play but if that's the case you'll have a better time just buying a physical set.
An undo button would be fantastic as I've accidentally confirmed actions many times. Other than that it is a beautiful port of a fantastic game.
Great digital version of the board game plus a creative, challenging single player campaign mode.
Good implementation, but no online  multiplayer and seems to be missing some of the goal cards, namely most completed rooms and most external entrances.

A great implementation of a great game. Controls are really intuitive. The AI is a bit weak, I have about 75% winrate in 4 player games vs AI, and sometimes AI does pretty clear mistakes (once an opponent took a 15 cost room in the first round and sometimes they deliberately block exits from rooms). It is especially a bit of a problem when online play is not implemented. But I know how hard it is to make a good AI for board games, and it is playable, so it's ok.  The controls and GUI are intuitive and sufficient. Confirm and rotate buttons could be a bit more far away from each other, and I too often forget about the king bonuses. Maybe if there was some announcement of them before the game or something, so that they are harder to oversee.  Overally I liked it.
My favorite board game on my phone
Great game.
This is an amazing game.  It has great mechanics, intuitive controls, and is strategy heavy.   The soundtrack is very beautiful, I would love to be able to get it separately.
Addicted to this game. However I  would love to see the rotate button moved far away  from the confirm button. I have pressed it by accident on my phone screen multiple times.
Would love an online multiplayer option. It satisfies my constant craving to play the boardgame.
Played the board game version a few times and it's a faithful reconstruction and love having a campaign mode
Double donkey dope game.
Fun puzzle game, there is a board game if you like it.
Jeremiah, do you have any plans to add the "Secrets" expansion to the app?  Also, where is the app soundtrack from? My wife and I love the game and the app! Great job!
Such a strategic game. Really makes you think and plan.
Fun game to play and it works. My biggest complaint is that the AI is too easy.
I wish it had an online multiplayer, but it is a very faithful port of a wonderful board game, and the single player campaign is very engaging.
Great implementation of a great board game.  The campaign mode makes for an engaging single player experience.
True to the boardgame, a good play!
Tutorial is too big for my screen, on my Moto Z Force. I can't find the accept check mark.
Really fun and well implemented!

Overall, if you're a fan of Castles you should buy this game. However, in order to improve the game, the A.I. needs to be better implemented: it routinely prices poorly such as favor tiles being on the low end, all computer players will pass if prices are appropriate such as a double favor tile being 15 or 10 for an example. On more than one occasion I've seen the computer player block itself in leaving it unable to purchase tiles the rest of the game. Instructions for campaign are sometimes not clear. Needs online play with friends.
I got this to learn the boardgame, but I find this more addicting to play because of the campaign. I hope the Secrets expansion. I'd like to learn that too.

My family liked the game so much we ordered the board game and expansion. My wife also purchased the IOS version because she liked it so much. I would pay for the expansion if it were available for the app.

Great game. Wish there were a way to view the manual in-game. Would be 5 stars if there were a verification prompt when you end your turn without completing any actions - it's too easy to accidentally click 'done' when scrolling around the map.
This is a great version of a great game.
I think that the app is great and plays true to the boardgame. If it had online play i would give it 5 stars.
Great adaptation of a good board game. Plays great. Campaign mode is fun. I highly recommend this game
The AI cheats. When all the computer controlled players PASS on my turn so I get zero money is bullsh!t. And it happens EVERY GAME. Frustrating and cheap tactics with uninformed scoring.
replyContent: I'm sorry you're frustrated, but I don't believe it warrants a 1-Star rating. The AI does not cheat. Passing when the Master Builder has $0 is a strong tactic to deny him income, prevent him from purchasing, and limit his options on future turns. Though arguably mean-spirited, it's perfectly legal, and often the most beneficial move for players.

content: This app does a fantastic job of replicating the game. The only thing missing that I see is online multi-player as with pass and play it's too hard not to see other players' utility cards. Not that this has stopped us from enjoying it thoroughly. Good job!
Fun puzzle, great with friends or alone
Awesome port of the board game...update suburbia to be more like this!
Great port of the board game with good AI. Regular game and campaign mode with challenges. Hours and hours of fun
I love this game but I've finished the campaign and i need more!!!!
Fun game, just like the board game. Some of the levels are literally impossible. Playing against other humans would be a nice addition.
This is an enjoyable game.  Only thing is that I with they would explain what the symbols mean on the castle tiles and how certain rooms proc extra turns/pts etc in the tutorial.
Nice game.

I was really loving this app and a 5 star rating seemed likely, but then I came across the Hostile Brothers campaign. This is frustrating and I believe impossible, it needs to be fixed; remove pieces that can't be played and if I can't play living spaces why can the AI? Game also needs an undo button for mistakes. I've found other campaigns that I don't think are possible to beat.

Tutorial was generally good, as a person who had never encountered the game before. I found myself looking up things in the help menu for a while, afterwards, though. I don't feel like I had a good grasp of card mechanics, rewards, or where to look for information in some cases. Otherwise, everything runs very smoothly and the game is plenty engaging! May find it's way to my tabletop before long.

Great game, but please fix following bugs: when playing in flight mode, the game keeps restarting. The colors of players are mixed when restarting the game. Also some kind of history of the previous match scores would be helpful.
Fun figuring out combinations as well as being a challenge. The campaign mode is a great addition.
Great game
Great Game

I was going last in a 3 player game, and bought a Food Room. The placement of it ensured it would be completed as I placed it, and I expected to take my extra turn to buy a small Living Room, placing and completing that as well, for another 10 points. Instead, after placing the Food Room, the game ended.  The rules say the game ends after the final round, not after the first action of the final player in the final round.
Represent the Boardgame very well
I'm still bad at it, though.
One of my favorite games that I can never get people to play. This app lets me play whenever I want, and it gives me an easy way to show people how to play the board game version.

Easy to use. Great visuals. Love the stories. The campaign mode has interesting challenges and the match mode is awesome. Love the automated point tallies as that was my least favorite part on the board game.
This is a great game. Very good implementation of a great idea. I would like to have that undo button, though! I too keep mistakengly place Confirm button instead of Rotate.  :)

Really enjoying the game. Could use a bit more detail in the tutorial. Had to ask a friend to finally understand how you earn coins. Still not totally clear on it and on the strategy of being the builder and rearranging the costs each turn. But otherwise the game has kept me engaged.
I truly love this game. It had become my favorite game.

Very good translation of the board game into app form. Extremely fun, for a fraction of the price.  There are a few flaws,  though.  You have to memorize your bonus cards,  because there's no way to review them during play.  The field of view is tiny,  so deciding where to put a piece takes ages.  And the scoring at the end of the game is incomprehensible.  You only know who won,  not why or how,  so there's no way to learn how to improve oneself. Despite these minor flaws,  definitely worth the purchase.
Follows the board game well.  And makes calculating you score super easy.

Fun to play. A good interpretation of a great game. My one complaint- It would be nice to play this on my Android TV devices- my gamepads would make it much easier to play, and it is _really_ small on my phone!
What is the music though? It's so good! I want a soundtrack!
Really fun to play, easy to use no real glitches so far
This app really takes advantage of what a device version of this game can offer while sacrificing none of the originals joy.
I love the challenge of playing single player, as well as against opponents. Great setup for teaching what could be a complicated game.
Very fun game and pretty good app. Would be better if you could play online or against others locally (on same wifi or whatever).

Will purchase again once there is a better way to play multiplayer. Online would be great, but at least have Wi-Fi connection or Bluetooth as an option.  I would pay extra for that. Pass and play is a pain. Please bring expansions when you get a chance, but prioritize better multiplayer.  Game looks good otherwise. I will repurchase and change to 4 stars once there is better multiplayer options, 5 stars if online play is an option.

Very good implementation of a very unique board game.  Take seriously the advice to use 5 inch screen or larger... designers have done their best, but some bits are not quite legible on Nexus 5.      I'd love to see an Undo button.  I've accidentally pressed the check mark button to commit an unintended action too many times now.  My fault, but it is detracting from my enjoyment of an excellent game.

The app takes the somewhat frightening looking boardgame, and shows how logical and easy it is to actually play it! The base game was already great this is a good implementation. Some minor issues remain, like it's very easy to accidentally end your turn when you want to rotate the tile.
Great game, especially enjoyed the campaign for solo players. Many hours of fun.

Great App of one of my favourite board games. Some of the campaign missions are a bit too difficult at times though (read Hostile Brothers). The game can also enter a state where you cannot continue and the AI will constantly pass. This requires either a restart which can get annoying. But still love it.
And good replay value. You'll have to do many of the campaign scenarios multiple times to get a perfect score.
The challenges add extra depth to an already great game.

I love this game and really enjoy playing the campaign but I've run into a couple issues. 1) I should be able to report bugs from within the app. 2) I emailed about a bug a week ago and have gotten no response. 3) In the setup of a game, I just got the notification that there weren't enough bonus cards for me to take any, even though the computer player after me got to take 2. I restarted the game and got the same thing. No point playing with the game stacked against me that much.
replyContent: I'm so sorry you had issues! I do my best to monitor and respond to the support email, but your message must have slipped through. Generally restarting the app (not just closing it, but totally quitting it) or the device is enough to clear issues like the one you had with Bonus Cards. Thanks for your purchase and taking the time to leave feedback!

content: I thought it'd be hard to translate the board game to a phone's screen, but color me impressed. Very well made game!

This is a well implemented electronic version of the excellent table top game. It not only has a great interface for ordering tiles for purchase, but makes it easier to perform you're placement by showing possible locations. The campaign acts as a great training mechanism, to bring someone up to speed, if they have never played before.  Overall, a great game and well worth a purchase.
Great adaptation of the board game.
Lots of fun,  true to the boardgame. No bugs. Works great. Value for money imho.
All it needs is online play and we're set!
Pretty much accurate representation
So much fun, I just wish there was more to the campaign so I could keep playing.
It's really confusing. The tutorial did not help much. It crashed on me after a bit.
Excellent app of an exceptional boardgame.
This is a great tile laying game. Fans of Carcassonne will probably love it.
Really enjoyed the game play without having to set up all the pieces. ;)
Great game. It is easier to learn to play on here. Now I feel like I could get the board game and not be overwhelmed.

Great, slick implementation. The AI is capable of beating me, although they are sometimes too grabby at very expensive rooms to be competitive (spending all 15 coins first turn, for instance). Online play would be needed for a 5th star.  EDIT 8/4/16: This app is quite buggy. The following issues occur regularly:  If you are playing one of the unopposed campaign scenarios and shut down the app, sometimes there are less slots when you re-open the app (6 tiles available to build instead of 7)  if you restart a campaign scenario, sometimes the utility cards that were used last game are not "shuffled" back into the deck. eventually, if you try a scenario a bunch of times, the deck is empty from the start and you cant draw any cards. it is best to completely close the app and then restart, refusing to continue your existing castle.  if you close the app and restart it, sometimes rooms (especially corridors) disappear.  If you close the app and restart it, then complete a room you started before you closed the app, sometimes you do not receive that room's bonus.  I am downgrading my review from 4 stars to 2.
Are favors and solo play missing? Also, the expansion Secrets would be nice at some point.
Still learning the game. No issues yet, plays smooth, looks great.
Good game...there are a few rules from the board version that are not followed. Otherwise, very good version of the awesome game.
Overall, this is a great port of a great boardgame. With that said, online play and sync between devices would easily make this a five star experience.
Haven't played much yet, but so far it's a perfect port of a board game.
I just wish they would add the Secrets expansion
I love the campaign mode when you want to try a challenge outside of the normal game. It crashed on me once but the latest update has been problem free.
I played the boardgame once and decided to buy the app, and I wasn't disappointed. The AI might need a few tweaks, but other than that it's great.
Need to read up rules but seems interesting
Missing a handy in-game reference of room completion bonus.

Easy to use. Kudos to the designers who created the campaigns, very challenging. I only wish it listed details of points acquired as a better "teaching aide" of the tabletop version (hard to say if that's going to collect dust now). I also think the pass/collect money button is in the accidentally hit zone when holding tablet. **Edit: Today I saw the breakdown of points in the lower corner, somehow I missed that the past few days doing campaigns, since I'm usually looking on the right side observing $/pts.
I like this game a lot
Well done implementation of the board game. The single player campaign is fun.

Smooth game. It's very well made and the tutorial made the game really easy to learn. I never played the table top version but I will be buying that now too. It's well balanced and the campaign keeps things interesting.
My basment rooms are not scoring when they are completed.
Solid reproduction, stable all, Google Play Games integration... Great stuff.
Computer players make obvious mistakes. Lacking online play.
This game would be so awesome with online play. I would pay more.money to play with my friends via WiFi or 4g
Good campaign, fun AI. Good work! Looking forward to the expansion being added.
This was already my favorite boardgame, now it's my favorite app.
This is a great adaptation of an awesome board game!
Love the board game and this app, but it needs to ability to play against other players.
Glad this finally came out. I've been waiting a year! Love it so far. Would like to see an online play option in the future.
Captures the board game very well!

This is a really well-done game, and lots of fun.  Would be even better with online play, but still a worth it.  Great tutorial, and great way to learn the game - and to play when opponents aren't available or in spare moments.
Would be great if you can play with others online, but all and all very fun. The campaign is challenging and replay value is high.
Love the game and it a great digital version of the IRL game; however, lacks online multiplayer (pretty much the standard of digital boardgames).  Would be 5* with an online mode.
Best app of 2016
You'll like this too. The campaign mode is quite cool too.

The UI is perfect. The tutorial is polished and complete. The campaign gives this added fun. I'm not sure how good the AI is, but I suspect it's strong. I've played the physical board game against good competing and don't win often, but I've beaten the AI about half the time (but not by much). The AI is very smart about setting prices for tiles, which a surprises me. I wish the AI had levels or clear personality types, but this game is fun even single player because of the puzzle building, point maximizing.
Plays very much like the board game. It operates great with many little details like zoom on the tiles, review end goals, etc. Worth the $.

Been waiting for a digital version of this game for a while,and it's been worth the wait. A near flawless version of the table top game. Losses one star for no online play (I'll play the real version if I have to do pass and play)

Despite flaws, very entertaining.  Anticipating release for a long time, and a bit overpriced.  Not sure if computer players have different abilities or not, but wish difficulty could be adjustable.  Needs a "help"/"rules" from main page.  Wish there was a way to speed through computer players' turns (pace is slow).
This game rules!!! I've always wanted to try the board game. Now I know I HAVE to get it. But the app is a great value because of the awesome campaign. It runs great on my nexus7 and my droid MAXX.
Great adaptation of the board game.
Finally! Worth the wait.

This is my first time playing Castles and it's really a lot of fun. The port to mobile however is very poor. No online play, navigation is very confusing (you have to press New Game to be able to get back to the menu!) and the UI looks like it was designed in the 90s!
replyContent: Sorry that you were disappointed in the app, but thank you for your purchase and taking the time to leave a review. We appreciate the feedback!

content: Extra win conditions make this more fun than the boardgame
Good tutorial. If you like tile placing games, this is for you.
Fantastic!
Plays really well!
